solution_line_template: The amount of money deducted from Adam's daily pay is ${daily_pay} / {tax_divisor} = $<<{daily_pay}/{tax_divisor}={daily_tax_deduction}>>{daily_tax_deduction}.
So after deducting 10%, Adam's daily pay is ${daily_pay} - ${daily_tax_deduction} = $<<{daily_pay}-{daily_tax_deduction}={daily_pay_after_tax}>>{daily_pay_after_tax}.
This means that in {work_days} days he earns ${daily_pay_after_tax} * {work_days} = $<<{daily_pay_after_tax}*{work_days}={total_earned_after_tax}>>{total_earned_after_tax}.
